column5: Has anyone anyone visited the Reel em Lodge near Morson ? is see its a boat in just wondering what type of place it is and what experiences they had Thanks

I've never walked around the resort, and I have not met the owners. But... it is in a pretty great fishing location on Lake of the Woods. It is way out west (compared to us). You won't see a ton of boats out there, and you won't need to go far for good fishing. Sorry I don't have more information, but hope that helps!

I've got a neighbor just up from me that has gone there for many years.He's quite a fisherman and fished with the late, great Tommy Skarlis on many an occasion.We visit with each other after our semi annual Canada trips each time. He has had nothing but good things to say about the camp, the fishing, and the owners.

Thank You for the replies Well after reading what others have posted it sounds to be very interesting I have never done a boat in until I started searching for places to fish in Canada This might be a interesting experience
Youngs wilderness camp might be an option for you as well.http://youngswildernesscamp.com/
i bet that is a heck of a location like jared said and probably don't see to many boats out that way, looks like a 18-20 mile boat ride from government dock in morson

We stay in milesbay but I spend most of the week fishing in that area. My biggest walleye (28")and musky (52"") that I've caught in LOWS come from around firebag. Biggest smallmouth in my life came from milebay( 22.5"") There are more boats buzzing around that area than most might think. I think some come from flag Island in minasota. Not that far from there.
I have been going to Tamarack Lodge for a few years now And I love it. They are 8 miles West of Morson.
